007import edu.wpi.first.hal.AllianceStationID;

029/** Provide access to the network communication data to / from the Driver Station. */
030public final class DriverStation {
031  /** Number of Joystick ports. */
032  public static final int kJoystickPorts = 6;
033
034  private static final class HALJoystickButtons {
035    public int m_buttons;
036    public byte m_count;
037  }
038
039  private static class HALJoystickAxes {
040    public final float[] m_axes;
041    public int m_count;
042
043    HALJoystickAxes(int count) {
044      m_axes = new float[count];
045    }
046  }
047
048  private static class HALJoystickAxesRaw {
049    public final int[] m_axes;
050
051    @SuppressWarnings("unused")
052    public int m_count;
053
054    HALJoystickAxesRaw(int count) {
055      m_axes = new int[count];
056    }
057  }
058
059  private static class HALJoystickPOVs {
060    public final short[] m_povs;
061    public int m_count;
062
063    HALJoystickPOVs(int count) {
064      m_povs = new short[count];
065      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
066        m_povs[i] = -1;
067      }
068    }
069  }
070
071  /** The robot alliance that the robot is a part of. */
072  public enum Alliance {
073    /** Red alliance. */
074    Red,
075    /** Blue alliance. */
076    Blue
077  }
078
079  /** The type of robot match that the robot is part of. */
080  public enum MatchType {
081    /** None. */
082    None,
083    /** Practice. */
084    Practice,
085    /** Qualification. */
086    Qualification,
087    /** Elimination. */
088    Elimination
089  }
090
091  private static final double JOYSTICK_UNPLUGGED_MESSAGE_INTERVAL = 1.0;
092  private static double m_nextMessageTime;
093
094  @SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
095  private static class MatchDataSender {
096    final StringPublisher gameSpecificMessage;
097    final StringPublisher eventName;
098    final IntegerPublisher matchNumber;
099    final IntegerPublisher replayNumber;
100    final IntegerPublisher matchType;
101    final BooleanPublisher alliance;
102    final IntegerPublisher station;
103    final IntegerPublisher controlWord;
104    boolean oldIsRedAlliance = true;
105    int oldStationNumber = 1;
106    String oldEventName = "";
107    String oldGameSpecificMessage = "";
108    int oldMatchNumber;
109    int oldReplayNumber;
110    int oldMatchType;
111    int oldControlWord;
112
113    MatchDataSender() {
114      var table = NetworkTableInstance.getDefault().getTable("FMSInfo");
115      table.getStringTopic(".type").publish().set("FMSInfo");
116      gameSpecificMessage = table.getStringTopic("GameSpecificMessage").publish();
117      gameSpecificMessage.set("");
118      eventName = table.getStringTopic("EventName").publish();
119      eventName.set("");
120      matchNumber = table.getIntegerTopic("MatchNumber").publish();
121      matchNumber.set(0);
122      replayNumber = table.getIntegerTopic("ReplayNumber").publish();
123      replayNumber.set(0);
124      matchType = table.getIntegerTopic("MatchType").publish();
125      matchType.set(0);
126      alliance = table.getBooleanTopic("IsRedAlliance").publish();
127      alliance.set(true);
128      station = table.getIntegerTopic("StationNumber").publish();
129      station.set(1);
130      controlWord = table.getIntegerTopic("FMSControlData").publish();
131      controlWord.set(0);
132    }
133
134    private void sendMatchData() {
135      AllianceStationID allianceID = DriverStationJNI.getAllianceStation();
136      final int stationNumber =
137          switch (allianceID) {
138            case Blue1, Red1 -> 1;
139            case Blue2, Red2 -> 2;
140            case Blue3, Red3, Unknown -> 3;
141          };
142      final boolean isRedAlliance =
143          switch (allianceID) {
144            case Blue1, Blue2, Blue3 -> false;
145            case Red1, Red2, Red3, Unknown -> true;
146          };
147
148      String currentEventName;
149      String currentGameSpecificMessage;
150      int currentMatchNumber;
151      int currentReplayNumber;
152      int currentMatchType;
153      int currentControlWord;
154      m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
155      try {
156        currentEventName = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.eventName;
157        currentGameSpecificMessage = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.gameSpecificMessage;
158        currentMatchNumber = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.matchNumber;
159        currentReplayNumber = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.replayNumber;
160        currentMatchType = DriverStation.m_matchInfo.matchType;
161      } finally {
162        m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
163      }
164      currentControlWord = DriverStationJNI.nativeGetControlWord();
165
166      if (oldIsRedAlliance != isRedAlliance) {
167        alliance.set(isRedAlliance);
168        oldIsRedAlliance = isRedAlliance;
169      }
170      if (oldStationNumber != stationNumber) {
171        station.set(stationNumber);
172        oldStationNumber = stationNumber;
173      }
174      if (!oldEventName.equals(currentEventName)) {
175        eventName.set(currentEventName);
176        oldEventName = currentEventName;
177      }
178      if (!oldGameSpecificMessage.equals(currentGameSpecificMessage)) {
179        gameSpecificMessage.set(currentGameSpecificMessage);
180        oldGameSpecificMessage = currentGameSpecificMessage;
181      }
182      if (currentMatchNumber != oldMatchNumber) {
183        matchNumber.set(currentMatchNumber);
184        oldMatchNumber = currentMatchNumber;
185      }
186      if (currentReplayNumber != oldReplayNumber) {
187        replayNumber.set(currentReplayNumber);
188        oldReplayNumber = currentReplayNumber;
189      }
190      if (currentMatchType != oldMatchType) {
191        matchType.set(currentMatchType);
192        oldMatchType = currentMatchType;
193      }
194      if (currentControlWord != oldControlWord) {
195        controlWord.set(currentControlWord);
196        oldControlWord = currentControlWord;
197      }
198    }
199  }
200
201  private static class JoystickLogSender {
202    JoystickLogSender(DataLog log, int stick, long timestamp) {
203      m_stick = stick;
204
205      m_logButtons = new BooleanArrayLogEntry(log, "DS:joystick" + stick + "/buttons", timestamp);
206      m_logAxes = new FloatArrayLogEntry(log, "DS:joystick" + stick + "/axes", timestamp);
207      m_logPOVs = new IntegerArrayLogEntry(log, "DS:joystick" + stick + "/povs", timestamp);
208
209      appendButtons(m_joystickButtons[m_stick], timestamp);
210      appendAxes(m_joystickAxes[m_stick], timestamp);
211      appendPOVs(m_joystickPOVs[m_stick], timestamp);
212    }
213
214    public void send(long timestamp) {
215      HALJoystickButtons buttons = m_joystickButtons[m_stick];
216      if (buttons.m_count != m_prevButtons.m_count
217          || buttons.m_buttons != m_prevButtons.m_buttons) {
218        appendButtons(buttons, timestamp);
219      }
220
221      HALJoystickAxes axes = m_joystickAxes[m_stick];
222      int count = axes.m_count;
223      boolean needToLog = false;
224      if (count != m_prevAxes.m_count) {
225        needToLog = true;
226      } else {
227        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
228          if (axes.m_axes[i] != m_prevAxes.m_axes[i]) {
229            needToLog = true;
230            break;
231          }
232        }
233      }
234      if (needToLog) {
235        appendAxes(axes, timestamp);
236      }
237
238      HALJoystickPOVs povs = m_joystickPOVs[m_stick];
239      count = m_joystickPOVs[m_stick].m_count;
240      needToLog = false;
241      if (count != m_prevPOVs.m_count) {
242        needToLog = true;
243      } else {
244        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
245          if (povs.m_povs[i] != m_prevPOVs.m_povs[i]) {
246            needToLog = true;
247            break;
248          }
249        }
250      }
251      if (needToLog) {
252        appendPOVs(povs, timestamp);
253      }
254    }
255
256    void appendButtons(HALJoystickButtons buttons, long timestamp) {
257      byte count = buttons.m_count;
258      if (m_sizedButtons == null || m_sizedButtons.length != count) {
259        m_sizedButtons = new boolean[count];
260      }
261      int buttonsValue = buttons.m_buttons;
262      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
263        m_sizedButtons[i] = (buttonsValue & (1 << i)) != 0;
264      }
265      m_logButtons.append(m_sizedButtons, timestamp);
266      m_prevButtons.m_count = count;
267      m_prevButtons.m_buttons = buttons.m_buttons;
268    }
269
270    void appendAxes(HALJoystickAxes axes, long timestamp) {
271      int count = axes.m_count;
272      if (m_sizedAxes == null || m_sizedAxes.length != count) {
273        m_sizedAxes = new float[count];
274      }
275      System.arraycopy(axes.m_axes, 0, m_sizedAxes, 0, count);
276      m_logAxes.append(m_sizedAxes, timestamp);
277      m_prevAxes.m_count = count;
278      System.arraycopy(axes.m_axes, 0, m_prevAxes.m_axes, 0, count);
279    }
280
281    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidArrayLoops")
282    void appendPOVs(HALJoystickPOVs povs, long timestamp) {
283      int count = povs.m_count;
284      if (m_sizedPOVs == null || m_sizedPOVs.length != count) {
285        m_sizedPOVs = new long[count];
286      }
287      for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
288        m_sizedPOVs[i] = povs.m_povs[i];
289      }
290      m_logPOVs.append(m_sizedPOVs, timestamp);
291      m_prevPOVs.m_count = count;
292      System.arraycopy(povs.m_povs, 0, m_prevPOVs.m_povs, 0, count);
293    }
294
295    final int m_stick;
296    boolean[] m_sizedButtons;
297    float[] m_sizedAxes;
298    long[] m_sizedPOVs;
299    final HALJoystickButtons m_prevButtons = new HALJoystickButtons();
300    final HALJoystickAxes m_prevAxes = new HALJoystickAxes(DriverStationJNI.kMaxJoystickAxes);
301    final HALJoystickPOVs m_prevPOVs = new HALJoystickPOVs(DriverStationJNI.kMaxJoystickPOVs);
302    final BooleanArrayLogEntry m_logButtons;
303    final FloatArrayLogEntry m_logAxes;
304    final IntegerArrayLogEntry m_logPOVs;
305  }
306
307  private static class DataLogSender {
308    DataLogSender(DataLog log, boolean logJoysticks, long timestamp) {
309      m_logEnabled = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:enabled", timestamp);
310      m_logAutonomous = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:autonomous", timestamp);
311      m_logTest = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:test", timestamp);
312      m_logEstop = new BooleanLogEntry(log, "DS:estop", timestamp);
313
314      // append initial control word values
315      m_wasEnabled = m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
316      m_wasAutonomous = m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous();
317      m_wasTest = m_controlWordCache.getTest();
318      m_wasEstop = m_controlWordCache.getEStop();
319
320      m_logEnabled.append(m_wasEnabled, timestamp);
321      m_logAutonomous.append(m_wasAutonomous, timestamp);
322      m_logTest.append(m_wasTest, timestamp);
323      m_logEstop.append(m_wasEstop, timestamp);
324
325      if (logJoysticks) {
326        m_joysticks = new JoystickLogSender[kJoystickPorts];
327        for (int i = 0; i < kJoystickPorts; i++) {
328          m_joysticks[i] = new JoystickLogSender(log, i, timestamp);
329        }
330      } else {
331        m_joysticks = new JoystickLogSender[0];
332      }
333    }
334
335    public void send(long timestamp) {
336      // append control word value changes
337      boolean enabled = m_controlWordCache.getEnabled();
338      if (enabled != m_wasEnabled) {
339        m_logEnabled.append(enabled, timestamp);
340      }
341      m_wasEnabled = enabled;
342
343      boolean autonomous = m_controlWordCache.getAutonomous();
344      if (autonomous != m_wasAutonomous) {
345        m_logAutonomous.append(autonomous, timestamp);
346      }
347      m_wasAutonomous = autonomous;
348
349      boolean test = m_controlWordCache.getTest();
350      if (test != m_wasTest) {
351        m_logTest.append(test, timestamp);
352      }
353      m_wasTest = test;
354
355      boolean estop = m_controlWordCache.getEStop();
356      if (estop != m_wasEstop) {
357        m_logEstop.append(estop, timestamp);
358      }
359      m_wasEstop = estop;
360
361      // append joystick value changes
362      for (JoystickLogSender joystick : m_joysticks) {
363        joystick.send(timestamp);
364      }
365    }
366
367    boolean m_wasEnabled;
368    boolean m_wasAutonomous;
369    boolean m_wasTest;
370    boolean m_wasEstop;
371    final BooleanLogEntry m_logEnabled;
372    final BooleanLogEntry m_logAutonomous;
373    final BooleanLogEntry m_logTest;
374    final BooleanLogEntry m_logEstop;
375
376    final JoystickLogSender[] m_joysticks;
377  }
378
379  // Joystick User Data
380  private static HALJoystickAxes[] m_joystickAxes = new HALJoystickAxes[kJoystickPorts];
381  private static HALJoystickAxesRaw[] m_joystickAxesRaw = new HALJoystickAxesRaw[kJoystickPorts];
382  private static HALJoystickPOVs[] m_joystickPOVs = new HALJoystickPOVs[kJoystickPorts];
383  private static HALJoystickButtons[] m_joystickButtons = new HALJoystickButtons[kJoystickPorts];
384  private static MatchInfoData m_matchInfo = new MatchInfoData();
385  private static ControlWord m_controlWord = new ControlWord();
386  private static EventVector m_refreshEvents = new EventVector();
387
388  // Joystick Cached Data
389  private static HALJoystickAxes[] m_joystickAxesCache = new HALJoystickAxes[kJoystickPorts];
390  private static HALJoystickAxesRaw[] m_joystickAxesRawCache =
391      new HALJoystickAxesRaw[kJoystickPorts];
392  private static HALJoystickPOVs[] m_joystickPOVsCache = new HALJoystickPOVs[kJoystickPorts];
393  private static HALJoystickButtons[] m_joystickButtonsCache =
394      new HALJoystickButtons[kJoystickPorts];
395  private static MatchInfoData m_matchInfoCache = new MatchInfoData();
396  private static ControlWord m_controlWordCache = new ControlWord();
397
398  // Joystick button rising/falling edge flags
399  private static int[] m_joystickButtonsPressed = new int[kJoystickPorts];
400  private static int[] m_joystickButtonsReleased = new int[kJoystickPorts];
401
402  // preallocated byte buffer for button count
403  private static final ByteBuffer m_buttonCountBuffer = ByteBuffer.allocateDirect(1);
404
405  private static final MatchDataSender m_matchDataSender;
406  private static DataLogSender m_dataLogSender;
407
408  private static final ReentrantLock m_cacheDataMutex = new ReentrantLock();
409
410  private static boolean m_silenceJoystickWarning;

412  /**
413   * DriverStation constructor.
414   *
415   * <p>The single DriverStation instance is created statically with the instance static member
416   * variable.
417   */
418  private DriverStation() {}
419
420  static {
421    HAL.initialize(500, 0);
422
423    for (int i = 0; i < kJoystickPorts; i++) {
424      m_joystickButtons[i] = new HALJoystickButtons();
425      m_joystickAxes[i] = new HALJoystickAxes(DriverStationJNI.kMaxJoystickAxes);
426      m_joystickAxesRaw[i] = new HALJoystickAxesRaw(DriverStationJNI.kMaxJoystickAxes);
427      m_joystickPOVs[i] = new HALJoystickPOVs(DriverStationJNI.kMaxJoystickPOVs);
428
429      m_joystickButtonsCache[i] = new HALJoystickButtons();
430      m_joystickAxesCache[i] = new HALJoystickAxes(DriverStationJNI.kMaxJoystickAxes);
431      m_joystickAxesRawCache[i] = new HALJoystickAxesRaw(DriverStationJNI.kMaxJoystickAxes);
432      m_joystickPOVsCache[i] = new HALJoystickPOVs(DriverStationJNI.kMaxJoystickPOVs);
433    }
434
435    m_matchDataSender = new MatchDataSender();
436  }
437
438  /**
439   * Report error to Driver Station. Optionally appends Stack trace to error message.
440   *
441   * @param error The error to report.
442   * @param printTrace If true, append stack trace to error string
443   */
444  public static void reportError(String error, boolean printTrace) {
445    reportErrorImpl(true, 1, error, printTrace);
446  }
447
448  /**
449   * Report error to Driver Station. Appends provided stack trace to error message.
450   *
451   * @param error The error to report.
452   * @param stackTrace The stack trace to append
453   */
454  public static void reportError(String error, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
455    reportErrorImpl(true, 1, error, stackTrace);
456  }
457
458  /**
459   * Report warning to Driver Station. Optionally appends Stack trace to warning message.
460   *
461   * @param warning The warning to report.
462   * @param printTrace If true, append stack trace to warning string
463   */
464  public static void reportWarning(String warning, boolean printTrace) {
465    reportErrorImpl(false, 1, warning, printTrace);
466  }
467
468  /**
469   * Report warning to Driver Station. Appends provided stack trace to warning message.
470   *
471   * @param warning The warning to report.
472   * @param stackTrace The stack trace to append
473   */
474  public static void reportWarning(String warning, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
475    reportErrorImpl(false, 1, warning, stackTrace);
476  }
477
478  private static void reportErrorImpl(boolean isError, int code, String error, boolean printTrace) {
479    reportErrorImpl(isError, code, error, printTrace, Thread.currentThread().getStackTrace(), 3);
480  }
481
482  private static void reportErrorImpl(
483      boolean isError, int code, String error, StackTraceElement[] stackTrace) {
484    reportErrorImpl(isError, code, error, true, stackTrace, 0);
485  }
486
487  private static void reportErrorImpl(
488      boolean isError,
489      int code,
490      String error,
491      boolean printTrace,
492      StackTraceElement[] stackTrace,
493      int stackTraceFirst) {
494    String locString;
495    if (stackTrace.length >= stackTraceFirst + 1) {
496      locString = stackTrace[stackTraceFirst].toString();
497    } else {
498      locString = "";
499    }
500    StringBuilder traceString = new StringBuilder();
501    if (printTrace) {
502      boolean haveLoc = false;
503      for (int i = stackTraceFirst; i < stackTrace.length; i++) {
504        String loc = stackTrace[i].toString();
505        traceString.append("\tat ").append(loc).append('\n');
506        // get first user function
507        if (!haveLoc && !loc.startsWith("edu.wpi.first")) {
508          locString = loc;
509          haveLoc = true;
510        }
511      }
512    }
513    DriverStationJNI.sendError(
514        isError, code, false, error, locString, traceString.toString(), true);
515  }
516
517  /**
518   * The state of one joystick button. Button indexes begin at 1.
519   *
520   * @param stick The joystick to read.
521   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
522   * @return The state of the joystick button.
523   */
524  public static boolean getStickButton(final int stick, final int button) {
525    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
526      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
527    }
528    if (button <= 0) {
529      reportJoystickUnpluggedError("Button indexes begin at 1 in WPILib for C++ and Java\n");
530      return false;
531    }
532
533    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
534    try {
535      if (button <= m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count) {
536        return (m_joystickButtons[stick].m_buttons & 1 << (button - 1)) != 0;
537      }
538    } finally {
539      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
540    }
541
542    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
543        "Joystick Button "
544            + button
545            + " on port "
546            + stick
547            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
548    return false;
549  }
550
551  /**
552   * Whether one joystick button was pressed since the last check. Button indexes begin at 1.
553   *
554   * @param stick The joystick to read.
555   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
556   * @return Whether the joystick button was pressed since the last check.
557   */
558  public static boolean getStickButtonPressed(final int stick, final int button) {
559    if (button <= 0) {
560      reportJoystickUnpluggedError("Button indexes begin at 1 in WPILib for C++ and Java\n");
561      return false;
562    }
563    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
564      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
565    }
566
567    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
568    try {
569      if (button <= m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count) {
570        // If button was pressed, clear flag and return true
571        if ((m_joystickButtonsPressed[stick] & 1 << (button - 1)) != 0) {
572          m_joystickButtonsPressed[stick] &= ~(1 << (button - 1));
573          return true;
574        } else {
575          return false;
576        }
577      }
578    } finally {
579      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
580    }
581
582    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
583        "Joystick Button "
584            + button
585            + " on port "
586            + stick
587            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
588    return false;
589  }
590
591  /**
592   * Whether one joystick button was released since the last check. Button indexes begin at 1.
593   *
594   * @param stick The joystick to read.
595   * @param button The button index, beginning at 1.
596   * @return Whether the joystick button was released since the last check.
597   */
598  public static boolean getStickButtonReleased(final int stick, final int button) {
599    if (button <= 0) {
600      reportJoystickUnpluggedError("Button indexes begin at 1 in WPILib for C++ and Java\n");
601      return false;
602    }
603    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
604      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
605    }
606
607    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
608    try {
609      if (button <= m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count) {
610        // If button was released, clear flag and return true
611        if ((m_joystickButtonsReleased[stick] & 1 << (button - 1)) != 0) {
612          m_joystickButtonsReleased[stick] &= ~(1 << (button - 1));
613          return true;
614        } else {
615          return false;
616        }
617      }
618    } finally {
619      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
620    }
621
622    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
623        "Joystick Button "
624            + button
625            + " on port "
626            + stick
627            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
628    return false;
629  }
630
631  /**
632   * Get the value of the axis on a joystick. This depends on the mapping of the joystick connected
633   * to the specified port.
634   *
635   * @param stick The joystick to read.
636   * @param axis The analog axis value to read from the joystick.
637   * @return The value of the axis on the joystick.
638   */
639  public static double getStickAxis(int stick, int axis) {
640    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
641      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
642    }
643    if (axis < 0 || axis >= DriverStationJNI.kMaxJoystickAxes) {
644      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick axis is out of range");
645    }
646
647    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
648    try {
649      if (axis < m_joystickAxes[stick].m_count) {
650        return m_joystickAxes[stick].m_axes[axis];
651      }
652    } finally {
653      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
654    }
655
656    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
657        "Joystick axis "
658            + axis
659            + " on port "
660            + stick
661            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
662    return 0.0;
663  }
664
665  /**
666   * Get the state of a POV on the joystick.
667   *
668   * @param stick The joystick to read.
669   * @param pov The POV to read.
670   * @return the angle of the POV in degrees, or -1 if the POV is not pressed.
671   */
672  public static int getStickPOV(int stick, int pov) {
673    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
674      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
675    }
676    if (pov < 0 || pov >= DriverStationJNI.kMaxJoystickPOVs) {
677      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick POV is out of range");
678    }
679
680    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
681    try {
682      if (pov < m_joystickPOVs[stick].m_count) {
683        return m_joystickPOVs[stick].m_povs[pov];
684      }
685    } finally {
686      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
687    }
688
689    reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(
690        "Joystick POV "
691            + pov
692            + " on port "
693            + stick
694            + " not available, check if controller is plugged in");
695    return -1;
696  }
697
698  /**
699   * The state of the buttons on the joystick.
700   *
701   * @param stick The joystick to read.
702   * @return The state of the buttons on the joystick.
703   */
704  public static int getStickButtons(final int stick) {
705    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
706      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
707    }
708
709    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
710    try {
711      return m_joystickButtons[stick].m_buttons;
712    } finally {
713      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
714    }
715  }
716
717  /**
718   * Returns the number of axes on a given joystick port.
719   *
720   * @param stick The joystick port number
721   * @return The number of axes on the indicated joystick
722   */
723  public static int getStickAxisCount(int stick) {
724    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
725      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
726    }
727
728    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
729    try {
730      return m_joystickAxes[stick].m_count;
731    } finally {
732      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
733    }
734  }
735
736  /**
737   * Returns the number of povs on a given joystick port.
738   *
739   * @param stick The joystick port number
740   * @return The number of povs on the indicated joystick
741   */
742  public static int getStickPOVCount(int stick) {
743    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
744      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
745    }
746
747    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
748    try {
749      return m_joystickPOVs[stick].m_count;
750    } finally {
751      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
752    }
753  }
754
755  /**
756   * Gets the number of buttons on a joystick.
757   *
758   * @param stick The joystick port number
759   * @return The number of buttons on the indicated joystick
760   */
761  public static int getStickButtonCount(int stick) {
762    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
763      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
764    }
765
766    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
767    try {
768      return m_joystickButtons[stick].m_count;
769    } finally {
770      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
771    }
772  }
773
774  /**
775   * Gets the value of isXbox on a joystick.
776   *
777   * @param stick The joystick port number
778   * @return A boolean that returns the value of isXbox
779   */
780  public static boolean getJoystickIsXbox(int stick) {
781    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
782      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
783    }
784
785    return DriverStationJNI.getJoystickIsXbox((byte) stick) == 1;
786  }
787
788  /**
789   * Gets the value of type on a joystick.
790   *
791   * @param stick The joystick port number
792   * @return The value of type
793   */
794  public static int getJoystickType(int stick) {
795    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
796      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
797    }
798
799    return DriverStationJNI.getJoystickType((byte) stick);
800  }
801
802  /**
803   * Gets the name of the joystick at a port.
804   *
805   * @param stick The joystick port number
806   * @return The value of name
807   */
808  public static String getJoystickName(int stick) {
809    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
810      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
811    }
812
813    return DriverStationJNI.getJoystickName((byte) stick);
814  }
815
816  /**
817   * Returns the types of Axes on a given joystick port.
818   *
819   * @param stick The joystick port number
820   * @param axis The target axis
821   * @return What type of axis the axis is reporting to be
822   */
823  public static int getJoystickAxisType(int stick, int axis) {
824    if (stick < 0 || stick >= kJoystickPorts) {
825      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Joystick index is out of range, should be 0-5");
826    }
827
828    return DriverStationJNI.getJoystickAxisType((byte) stick, (byte) axis);
829  }
830
831  /**
832   * Returns if a joystick is connected to the Driver Station.
833   *
834   * <p>This makes a best effort guess by looking at the reported number of axis, buttons, and POVs
835   * attached.
836   *
837   * @param stick The joystick port number
838   * @return true if a joystick is connected
839   */
840  public static boolean isJoystickConnected(int stick) {
841    return getStickAxisCount(stick) > 0
842        || getStickButtonCount(stick) > 0
843        || getStickPOVCount(stick) > 0;
844  }
845
846  /**
847   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be enabled.
848   *
849   * @return True if the robot is enabled, false otherwise.
850   */
851  public static boolean isEnabled() {
852    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
853    try {
854      return m_controlWord.getEnabled() && m_controlWord.getDSAttached();
855    } finally {
856      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
857    }
858  }
859
860  /**
861   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be disabled.
862   *
863   * @return True if the robot should be disabled, false otherwise.
864   */
865  public static boolean isDisabled() {
866    return !isEnabled();
867  }
868
869  /**
870   * Gets a value indicating whether the Robot is e-stopped.
871   *
872   * @return True if the robot is e-stopped, false otherwise.
873   */
874  public static boolean isEStopped() {
875    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
876    try {
877      return m_controlWord.getEStop();
878    } finally {
879      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
880    }
881  }
882
883  /**
884   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
885   * autonomous mode.
886   *
887   * @return True if autonomous mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
888   */
889  public static boolean isAutonomous() {
890    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
891    try {
892      return m_controlWord.getAutonomous();
893    } finally {
894      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
895    }
896  }
897
898  /**
899   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
900   * autonomous mode and enabled.
901   *
902   * @return True if autonomous should be set and the robot should be enabled.
903   */
904  public static boolean isAutonomousEnabled() {
905    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
906    try {
907      return m_controlWord.getAutonomous() && m_controlWord.getEnabled();
908    } finally {
909      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
910    }
911  }
912
913  /**
914   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
915   * operator-controlled mode.
916   *
917   * @return True if operator-controlled mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
918   */
919  public static boolean isTeleop() {
920    return !(isAutonomous() || isTest());
921  }
922
923  /**
924   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in
925   * operator-controller mode and enabled.
926   *
927   * @return True if operator-controlled mode should be set and the robot should be enabled.
928   */
929  public static boolean isTeleopEnabled() {
930    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
931    try {
932      return !m_controlWord.getAutonomous()
933          && !m_controlWord.getTest()
934          && m_controlWord.getEnabled();
935    } finally {
936      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
937    }
938  }
939
940  /**
941   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in Test
942   * mode.
943   *
944   * @return True if test mode should be enabled, false otherwise.
945   */
946  public static boolean isTest() {
947    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
948    try {
949      return m_controlWord.getTest();
950    } finally {
951      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
952    }
953  }
954
955  /**
956   * Gets a value indicating whether the Driver Station requires the robot to be running in Test
957   * mode and enabled.
958   *
959   * @return True if test mode should be set and the robot should be enabled.
960   */
961  public static boolean isTestEnabled() {
962    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
963    try {
964      return m_controlWord.getTest() && m_controlWord.getEnabled();
965    } finally {
966      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
967    }
968  }

998  /**
999   * Get the game specific message from the FMS.
1000   *
1001   * <p>If the FMS is not connected, it is set from the game data setting on the driver station.
1002   *
1003   * @return the game specific message
1004   */
1005  public static String getGameSpecificMessage() {
1006    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1007    try {
1008      return m_matchInfo.gameSpecificMessage;
1009    } finally {
1010      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1011    }
1012  }

1014  /**
1015   * Get the event name from the FMS.
1016   *
1017   * @return the event name
1018   */
1019  public static String getEventName() {
1020    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1021    try {
1022      return m_matchInfo.eventName;
1023    } finally {
1024      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1025    }
1026  }
1027
1028  /**
1029   * Get the match type from the FMS.
1030   *
1031   * @return the match type
1032   */
1033  public static MatchType getMatchType() {
1034    int matchType;
1035    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1036    try {
1037      matchType = m_matchInfo.matchType;
1038    } finally {
1039      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1040    }
1041    return switch (matchType) {
1042      case 1 -> MatchType.Practice;
1043      case 2 -> MatchType.Qualification;
1044      case 3 -> MatchType.Elimination;
1045      default -> MatchType.None;
1046    };
1047  }
1048

1050   * Get the match number from the FMS.
1051   *
1052   * @return the match number
1053   */
1054  public static int getMatchNumber() {
1055    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1056    try {
1057      return m_matchInfo.matchNumber;
1058    } finally {
1059      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1060    }
1061  }

1064   * Get the replay number from the FMS.
1065   *
1066   * @return the replay number
1067   */
1068  public static int getReplayNumber() {
1069    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1070    try {
1071      return m_matchInfo.replayNumber;
1072    } finally {
1073      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1074    }

1076
1077  private static Map<AllianceStationID, Optional<Alliance>> m_allianceMap =
1078      Map.of(
1079          AllianceStationID.Unknown, Optional.empty(),
1080          AllianceStationID.Red1, Optional.of(Alliance.Red),
1081          AllianceStationID.Red2, Optional.of(Alliance.Red),
1082          AllianceStationID.Red3, Optional.of(Alliance.Red),
1083          AllianceStationID.Blue1, Optional.of(Alliance.Blue),
1084          AllianceStationID.Blue2, Optional.of(Alliance.Blue),
1085          AllianceStationID.Blue3, Optional.of(Alliance.Blue));
1086
1087  private static Map<AllianceStationID, OptionalInt> m_stationMap =
1088      Map.of(
1089          AllianceStationID.Unknown, OptionalInt.empty(),
1090          AllianceStationID.Red1, OptionalInt.of(1),
1091          AllianceStationID.Red2, OptionalInt.of(2),
1092          AllianceStationID.Red3, OptionalInt.of(3),
1093          AllianceStationID.Blue1, OptionalInt.of(1),
1094          AllianceStationID.Blue2, OptionalInt.of(2),
1095          AllianceStationID.Blue3, OptionalInt.of(3));
1096
1097  /**
1098   * Get the current alliance from the FMS.
1099   *
1100   * <p>If the FMS is not connected, it is set from the team alliance setting on the driver station.
1101   *
1102   * @return The alliance (red or blue) or an empty optional if the alliance is invalid
1103   */
1104  public static Optional<Alliance> getAlliance() {
1105    AllianceStationID allianceStationID = DriverStationJNI.getAllianceStation();
1106    if (allianceStationID == null) {
1107      allianceStationID = AllianceStationID.Unknown;
1108    }
1109
1110    return m_allianceMap.get(allianceStationID);
1111  }
1112
1113  /**
1114   * Gets the location of the team's driver station controls from the FMS.
1115   *
1116   * <p>If the FMS is not connected, it is set from the team alliance setting on the driver station.
1117   *
1118   * @return the location of the team's driver station controls: 1, 2, or 3
1119   */
1120  public static OptionalInt getLocation() {
1121    AllianceStationID allianceStationID = DriverStationJNI.getAllianceStation();
1122    if (allianceStationID == null) {
1123      allianceStationID = AllianceStationID.Unknown;
1124    }
1125
1126    return m_stationMap.get(allianceStationID);
1127  }
1128
1129  /**
1130   * Gets the raw alliance station of the teams driver station.
1131   *
1132   * <p>This returns the raw low level value. Prefer getLocation or getAlliance unless necessary for
1133   * performance.
1134   *
1135   * @return The raw alliance station id.
1136   */
1137  public static AllianceStationID getRawAllianceStation() {
1138    return DriverStationJNI.getAllianceStation();
1139  }
1140
1141  /**
1142   * Wait for a DS connection.
1143   *
1144   * @param timeoutSeconds timeout in seconds. 0 for infinite.
1145   * @return true if connected, false if timeout
1146   */
1147  public static boolean waitForDsConnection(double timeoutSeconds) {
1148    int event = WPIUtilJNI.createEvent(true, false);
1149    DriverStationJNI.provideNewDataEventHandle(event);
1150    boolean result;
1151    try {
1152      if (timeoutSeconds == 0) {
1153        WPIUtilJNI.waitForObject(event);
1154        result = true;
1155      } else {
1156        result = !WPIUtilJNI.waitForObjectTimeout(event, timeoutSeconds);
1157      }
1158    } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
1159      Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1160      result = false;
1161    } finally {
1162      DriverStationJNI.removeNewDataEventHandle(event);
1163      WPIUtilJNI.destroyEvent(event);
1164    }
1165    return result;
1166  }
1167
1168  /**
1169   * Return the approximate match time. The FMS does not send an official match time to the robots,
1170   * but does send an approximate match time. The value will count down the time remaining in the
1171   * current period (auto or teleop). Warning: This is not an official time (so it cannot be used to
1172   * dispute ref calls or guarantee that a function will trigger before the match ends).
1173   *
1174   * <p>When connected to the real field, this number only changes in full integer increments, and
1175   * always counts down.
1176   *
1177   * <p>When the DS is in practice mode, this number is a floating point number, and counts down.
1178   *
1179   * <p>When the DS is in teleop or autonomous mode, this number is a floating point number, and
1180   * counts up.
1181   *
1182   * <p>Simulation matches DS behavior without an FMS connected.
1183   *
1184   * @return Time remaining in current match period (auto or teleop) in seconds
1185   */
1186  public static double getMatchTime() {
1187    return DriverStationJNI.getMatchTime();
1188  }
1189
1190  /**
1191   * Allows the user to specify whether they want joystick connection warnings to be printed to the
1192   * console. This setting is ignored when the FMS is connected -- warnings will always be on in
1193   * that scenario.
1194   *
1195   * @param silence Whether warning messages should be silenced.
1196   */
1197  public static void silenceJoystickConnectionWarning(boolean silence) {
1198    m_silenceJoystickWarning = silence;
1199  }
1200
1201  /**
1202   * Returns whether joystick connection warnings are silenced. This will always return false when
1203   * connected to the FMS.
1204   *
1205   * @return Whether joystick connection warnings are silenced.
1206   */
1207  public static boolean isJoystickConnectionWarningSilenced() {
1208    return !isFMSAttached() && m_silenceJoystickWarning;
1209  }
1210
1211  /**
1212   * Refresh the passed in control word to contain the current control word cache.
1213   *
1214   * @param word Word to refresh.
1215   */
1216  public static void refreshControlWordFromCache(ControlWord word) {
1217    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1218    try {
1219      word.update(m_controlWord);
1220    } finally {
1221      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1222    }
1223  }
1224
1225  /**
1226   * Copy data from the DS task for the user. If no new data exists, it will just be returned,
1227   * otherwise the data will be copied from the DS polling loop.
1228   */
1229  public static void refreshData() {
1230    DriverStationJNI.refreshDSData();
1231
1232    // Get the status of all the joysticks
1233    for (byte stick = 0; stick < kJoystickPorts; stick++) {
1234      m_joystickAxesCache[stick].m_count =
1235          DriverStationJNI.getJoystickAxes(stick, m_joystickAxesCache[stick].m_axes);
1236      m_joystickAxesRawCache[stick].m_count =
1237          DriverStationJNI.getJoystickAxesRaw(stick, m_joystickAxesRawCache[stick].m_axes);
1238      m_joystickPOVsCache[stick].m_count =
1239          DriverStationJNI.getJoystickPOVs(stick, m_joystickPOVsCache[stick].m_povs);
1240      m_joystickButtonsCache[stick].m_buttons =
1241          DriverStationJNI.getJoystickButtons(stick, m_buttonCountBuffer);
1242      m_joystickButtonsCache[stick].m_count = m_buttonCountBuffer.get(0);
1243    }
1244
1245    DriverStationJNI.getMatchInfo(m_matchInfoCache);
1246
1247    DriverStationJNI.getControlWord(m_controlWordCache);
1248
1249    DataLogSender dataLogSender;
1250    // lock joystick mutex to swap cache data
1251    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1252    try {
1253      for (int i = 0; i < kJoystickPorts; i++) {
1254        // If buttons weren't pressed and are now, set flags in m_buttonsPressed
1255        m_joystickButtonsPressed[i] |=
1256            ~m_joystickButtons[i].m_buttons & m_joystickButtonsCache[i].m_buttons;
1257
1258        // If buttons were pressed and aren't now, set flags in m_buttonsReleased
1259        m_joystickButtonsReleased[i] |=
1260            m_joystickButtons[i].m_buttons & ~m_joystickButtonsCache[i].m_buttons;
1261      }
1262
1263      // move cache to actual data
1264      HALJoystickAxes[] currentAxes = m_joystickAxes;
1265      m_joystickAxes = m_joystickAxesCache;
1266      m_joystickAxesCache = currentAxes;
1267
1268      HALJoystickAxesRaw[] currentAxesRaw = m_joystickAxesRaw;
1269      m_joystickAxesRaw = m_joystickAxesRawCache;
1270      m_joystickAxesRawCache = currentAxesRaw;
1271
1272      HALJoystickButtons[] currentButtons = m_joystickButtons;
1273      m_joystickButtons = m_joystickButtonsCache;
1274      m_joystickButtonsCache = currentButtons;
1275
1276      HALJoystickPOVs[] currentPOVs = m_joystickPOVs;
1277      m_joystickPOVs = m_joystickPOVsCache;
1278      m_joystickPOVsCache = currentPOVs;
1279
1280      MatchInfoData currentInfo = m_matchInfo;
1281      m_matchInfo = m_matchInfoCache;
1282      m_matchInfoCache = currentInfo;
1283
1284      ControlWord currentWord = m_controlWord;
1285      m_controlWord = m_controlWordCache;
1286      m_controlWordCache = currentWord;
1287
1288      dataLogSender = m_dataLogSender;
1289    } finally {
1290      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1291    }
1292
1293    m_refreshEvents.wakeup();
1294
1295    m_matchDataSender.sendMatchData();
1296    if (dataLogSender != null) {
1297      dataLogSender.send(WPIUtilJNI.now());
1298    }
1299  }
1300
1301  /**
1302   * Registers the given handle for DS data refresh notifications.
1303   *
1304   * @param handle The event handle.
1305   */
1306  public static void provideRefreshedDataEventHandle(int handle) {
1307    m_refreshEvents.add(handle);
1308  }
1309
1310  /**
1311   * Unregisters the given handle from DS data refresh notifications.
1312   *
1313   * @param handle The event handle.
1314   */
1315  public static void removeRefreshedDataEventHandle(int handle) {
1316    m_refreshEvents.remove(handle);
1317  }
1318
1319  /**
1320   * Reports errors related to unplugged joysticks Throttles the errors so that they don't overwhelm
1321   * the DS.
1322   */
1323  private static void reportJoystickUnpluggedError(String message) {
1324    double currentTime = Timer.getFPGATimestamp();
1325    if (currentTime > m_nextMessageTime) {
1326      reportError(message, false);
1327      m_nextMessageTime = currentTime + JOYSTICK_UNPLUGGED_MESSAGE_INTERVAL;
1328    }
1329  }
1330
1331  /**
1332   * Reports errors related to unplugged joysticks Throttles the errors so that they don't overwhelm
1333   * the DS.
1334   */
1335  private static void reportJoystickUnpluggedWarning(String message) {
1336    if (isFMSAttached() || !m_silenceJoystickWarning) {
1337      double currentTime = Timer.getFPGATimestamp();
1338      if (currentTime > m_nextMessageTime) {
1339        reportWarning(message, false);
1340        m_nextMessageTime = currentTime + JOYSTICK_UNPLUGGED_MESSAGE_INTERVAL;
1341      }
1342    }
1343  }
1344
1345  /**
1346   * Starts logging DriverStation data to data log. Repeated calls are ignored.
1347   *
1348   * @param log data log
1349   * @param logJoysticks if true, log joystick data
1350   */
1351  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.NonThreadSafeSingleton")
1352  public static void startDataLog(DataLog log, boolean logJoysticks) {
1353    m_cacheDataMutex.lock();
1354    try {
1355      if (m_dataLogSender == null) {
1356        m_dataLogSender = new DataLogSender(log, logJoysticks, WPIUtilJNI.now());
1357      }
1358    } finally {
1359      m_cacheDataMutex.unlock();
1360    }
1361  }
1362
1363  /**
1364   * Starts logging DriverStation data to data log, including joystick data. Repeated calls are
1365   * ignored.
1366   *
1367   * @param log data log
1368   */
1369  public static void startDataLog(DataLog log) {
1370    startDataLog(log, true);
1371  }
1372}
